docs.text:
Overview


lua-csnappy is a binding of the 
csnappy
 library
which implements the Google's Snappy (de)compressor.


Snappy uses a 
LZ77
-type
algorithm with a fixed, byte-oriented encoding.


References


The 
csnappy
 library is available
at 
http://github.com/zeevt/csnappy
.


The specification and the original C++ implementation of Snappy are available
at 
https://google.github.io/snappy/
.


Status


lua-csnappy is in beta stage.


It's developed for Lua 5.1, 5.2 & 5.3.


Download


lua-csnappy source can be downloaded from

GitHub
.


Installation


lua-csnappy is available via LuaRocks:


luarocks install lua-csnappy



or manually, with:


make install



Test


The test suite requires the module

lua-TestMore
.


make test



Copyright and License


Copyright © 2012-2015 François Perrad





This library is licensed under the terms of the BSD license,
like csnappy & Snappy.

docs.title: Copyright and License

docs.text:
Reference


compress( data )


Accept a string data and returns a compressed string or throws an error.


decompress( data )


Accept a string data and returns a decompressed string or throws an error.


Examples


local snappy = require 'snappy'

local compressed = snappy.compress(some_input)
local decompressed = snappy.decompress(compressed)
docs.title: API

docs.text: compress( data )  Accept a string data and returns a compressed string or throws an error.  decompress( data )  Accept a string data and returns a decompressed string or throws an error.
docs.title: Reference
